Pakistanâ€™s Field Marshal Syed Asim Munir, in a public embarrassment, has been caught passing off a 2019 image of exercises being carried out by the Chinese Peopleâ€™s Liberation Army, as evidence of â€œPakistanâ€™s operational success in Operation Bunyan-um-Marsoosâ€ against India. As per a press release by the Inter-Services Public Relations, the media wing of the Pakistan Armed Forces, at a dinner event held by Pakistan Field Marshal Munir â€œto honour the political leadership, steadfast commitment of the Armed Forces, and the indomitable spirit of the people of Pakistan,â€ he gifted a framed picture to Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif showing rockets being launched. â€˜Operation Bunyan-um-Marsoosâ€™ reads the title below the image, while the caption below that describes an operation by the Regiment of Pakistan Artillery. The Pakistan Army named its retaliation to Indiaâ€™s Operation Sindoor as â€˜Operation Bunyan-um-Marsoos. What comes off as odd is the pictureâ€™s striking resemblance to an earlier image available on the website of Chinaâ€™s Ministry of Defence. The 2019 image by Chinese military displays a night raid exercise of long-range multiple launch rocket systems in northwest China. While Chinaâ€™s image contains only a singular rocket launcher prominently in the frame, the picture being presented by Mr. Munir to Mr. Shehbaz prominently shows at least three launchers operating simultaneously. However, only a cursory glance at both the images reveal the same exact background showing a large plume of smoke behind the Chinese launcher and the purported Pakistani launchers.

Karen Allen: This message claims that the pH of coronavirus is 5.5 to 8.5 and suggests eating alkaline foods like lemon, lime, avocado, garlic, mango, tangerine, pineapple, dandelion, and orange to 'beat' the virus; however, this is medically false and not supported by any scientific evidence.
